sense.name: a person or thing in the role of being a replacement for something else
sense.examples: The pink packets contain a sugar substitute, and the white packets contain sugar. There is just no substitute for real quality. They'll use a substitute for the star during the action scenes of the film. You can use raisins as a substitute if you don't have any currants.

sense.name: an athlete who is a second-stringer
sense.examples: They'll put a substitute in for that batter who can't run the bases so fast. His brother is the substitute catcher for a major league baseball team. How many substitutes is each team allowed during a game?

sense.name: emotional stand-in for the real object of desire which has been deprived
sense.commentary: SUBSTITUTE[+relation][+role][+stand_in][+emotional] Note: a specialized, psychological use of Sense 1
sense.examples: Mary's cats are clearly child substitutes in her life. John realized his boss had become a father substitute for him.
